Méfiez-vous des montreurs d'ours, très peu en ont capturés.



Presque tous les textes ci-dessous ont été publiés dans des journaux. Ces journaux participent activement au développement des mathématiques ; Je ne souhaite pas les court-circuiter mais offrir un accès (1) rapide (2) à tous. J'encourage vivement les personnes qui le peuvent à se procurer les revues dans lesquelles ces articles sont publiés. Toute utilisation autre que personnelle et à des fins "académiques" est interdite.

 The Jussieu Call 

 The Substituting APC for subscriptions: The Cure is Worse than the Disease 

Most of the texts below have been published elsewhere so copyright restrictions may apply if you do not use them for your own scholarly use. Mathematical journals contribute actively to the development of mathematics. My aim is not to circumvent them but to offer a (1) fast and (2) unlimited access to mathematical literature. I do hope people who can *will* get the journal (if any) in which the paper they need has been published. Use of them is forbidden if not for academical and personal purpose.

Là-bas se trouvent quelques productions de la descendance !

        
Please be aware that the texts given below may not be the ones that are finally published, especially if the paper is less than three years old. I will send the proper final version to anyone who requests it.
  • Articles de recherche

    1. Sieve
      • On S'nirel'man's constant (1995)
        Annali della Scuola Superiore di Pisa  vol. 22 no 4, pages 645--705    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 1] 
        We prove that every even integer is a sum of at most six primes.
      • Additive properties of dense subsets of sifted sequences (2001)
        avec Imre Ruzsa
        Journal de théorie des nombres de Bordeaux  vol. 13 no 2, pages 559--581    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 2] 
        We examine additive properties of denses subsets of sifted sequences, and in particular prove under very general assumptions that such a sequence is an additive asymptotic basis whose order is very well controled.
      • Eigenvalues in the large sieve inequality (2007)
        Functiones et Approximatio  vol. 37, pages 399--427    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 3] 
        We provide some evidence that the eigenvalues of the hermitian form ∑a/q|∑n≤Nφne(na/q)|2∑a/q|∑n≤Nφne(na/q)|2 tend to have a limit distribution when NN and QQ go simultaneously to infinity in such a way that N/Q2N/Q2 tends to a constant.
      • Improving on the Brun-Titchmarsh Theorem (2008)
        avec Jan-Christof Schlage-Puchta
        Acta Arithmetica  vol. 131 no 4, pages 351--366    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 4] 
        We prove that the number of primes in an interval of length NN is at most 2N/(logN+3.53)2N/(log⁡N+3.53) when NN is large enough. This is obtained through a sieving process which can be seen as a hybrid between the large sieve and the Selberg sieve, and draws on what we call "local models".
      • Eigenvalues in the large sieve inequality, II (2010)
        Journal de Théorie des nombres de Bordeaux  vol. 22 no 1, pages 181--196    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 5] 
        We explore numerically the eigenvalues of the hermitian form
        ∑q≤Q∑amod∗q∣∣∑n≤Nφne(na/q)∣∣2∑q≤Q∑amod∗q|∑n≤Nφne(na/q)|2
        when N=∑q≤Qϕ(q)N=∑q≤Qϕ(q). We improve on the existing upper bound, and produce a (conjectural) plot of the asymptotic distribution of its eigenvalues by exploiting fairly extensive computations. The main outcome is that this asymptotic density most probably exists but is not continuous with respect to the Lebesgue measure.
      • On long κκ-tuples with few prime factors (2012)
        Proceedings of the London Mathematical Society  vol. 104 no 1, pages 158--196    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 6] 
        We prove that there are infinitely many integers nn such that the total number of prime factors of (n+h1)⋯(n+hκ)(n+h1)⋯(n+hκ) is exactly (1+o(1))κlogκ(1+o(1))κlog⁡κ. Our result even ensures us that these prime factors are fairly evenly distributed among every factors n+hin+hi.
      • On long κκ-tuples: small values of κκ (2010)
        16 pages    » Abstract  » Local pdf+[Preprint no 1] 
        This paper is the sequel of the previous one. I did not publish it at the time, as someone had claimed better results. This claim turned out to be false, but in between J. Maynard got better results via a different method. The one developped here, as well as the questions it raises, are hopefully still of interest!
      • Additive energy of dense sets of primes and monochromatic sums (2014)
        avec D. S. Ramana
        Israel Journal of Mathematics  vol. 199, pages 955--974    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 7] 
        When K≥1K≥1 is an integer and SS is a set of prime numbers in the interval (N/2,N](N/2,N] with |S|≥π∗(N)/K|S|≥π∗(N)/K, where π∗(N)π∗(N) is the number of primes in this interval, we obtain an upper bound for the additive energy of SS, which is the number of quadruples (x1,x2,x3,x4)(x1,x2,x3,x4) in S4S4 satisfying x1+x2=x3+x4x1+x2=x3+x4. We obtain this bound by a variant of a method of Ramaré and I. Ruzsa. Taken together with an argument due to N. Hegyvári and F. Hennecart this bound implies that when the sequence of prime numbers is coloured with KK colours, every sufficiently large integer can be written as a sum of no more than CKloglog4KCKlog⁡log⁡4K prime numbers, all of the same colour, where CC is an absolute constant. This assertion is optimal upto the value of CC and answers a question of A. Sárközy.
      • A note on additive properties of dense subsets of sifted sequences (2013)
        Bulletin of the London Mathematical Society  vol 45 no 4, pages 677--682    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 8] 
        In this paper we show that if AA is a subset of the primes with positive lower relative density δδ then A+AA+A must have positive lower density at least C1δ/loglog(1/δ)C1δ/log⁡log⁡(1/δ) in the natural numbers. Our argument uses the techniques developed by the author and I.Ruzsa in their work on additive properties of dense subsequences of sufficiently sifted sequences. The result is optimal and improves on recent work of K.Chipeniuk & M.Hamel. We continue by proving several similar results, by successively replacing the sequence of primes by the sequence of sums of two squares, by the sequence of those integers nn that are such that nn and n+1n+1 are both a sum of two squares and finally by the sequence of primes pp that are such that p+1p+1 is a sum of two squares. The second part of this paper contains a heuristical argument that leads to several conjectures concerning the existence of kk-term arithmetic progressions within these sequences. We conclude with some conjectures belonging to the Ramsey part of additive number theory.
      • Improving on the Brun-Titchmarsh Theorem, II (2016)
        avec Soroosh Yazdani
        Submitted 39 pages    » Abstract+[Preprint no 2] 
      • Monochromatic Sums of Squares (2018)
        avec Gyan Prakash et D.S. Ramana
        Mathematische Zeitschrift  vol 289 no 1-2, pages 51--69    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 9] 
        For any integer K≥1K≥1 let s(K)s(K) be the smallest integer such that in any colouring of the set of squares of the integers in KK colours every large enough integer can be written as a sum of no more than s(K)s(K) squares, all of the same colour. A problem proposed by Sárközy asks for optimal bounds for s(K)s(K) in terms of KK. It is known by a result of Hegyvéri and Hennecart that s(K)≥Kexp((log2+o(1))logKloglogK)s(K)≥Kexp⁡((log⁡2+o(1))log⁡Klog⁡log⁡K). In this article we show that s(K)≤Kexp((3log2+o(1))logKloglogK)s(K)≤Kexp⁡((3log⁡2+o(1))log⁡Klog⁡log⁡K). This improves on the bound s(K)≪ϵK2+ϵs(K)≪ϵK2+ϵ, which is the best available upper bound for s(K)s(K).
      • A spectral resolution of the large sieve (2025)
        Bulletin de la Société Mathématique de France  vol. 153 no 3, pages 575--636    » Abstract  » Local pdf+[Article no 10] 
        The quadratic form V(φ,Q)=∑q∼Q∑amod∗q|S(φ,a/q)|2V(φ,Q)=∑q∼Q∑amod∗q|S(φ,a/q)|2 and its eigenvalues are well understood when Q=o(N−−√)Q=o(N), while V(φ,Q)V(φ,Q) is expected to behave like a Riemann sum when N=o(Q)N=o(Q). The behavior in the range Q∈[N−−√,100N]Q∈[N,100N] is still mysterious. In the present work we present a full spectral analysis when Q≥N7/8Q≥N7/8 in terms of the eigenvalues of a one-parameter family of nuclear difference operators. We show in particular that (a smoothed version of) the quadratic form V(φ,Q)V(φ,Q) may stay \emph{away} from (6/π2)Q∑n|φn|2(6/π2)Q∑n|φn|2 when Q≍NQ≍N, though only on a vector space of positive but small dimension.


    2. Explicit estimates on primes or on the Moebius function
      1. Primes in Arithmetic Progressions (1996)
        avec Robert Rumely
        Mathematics of Computation  vol. 65 no 213, pages 397--425    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 11] 
        Strengthening work of Rosser, Schoenfeld, and McCurley, we establish explicit Chebyshev-type estimates in the prime number theorem for arithmetic progressions, for all moduli k≤72k≤72  and other small moduli.
      2. Explicit bounds on exponential sums and the scarcity of squarefree binomial coefficients (1996)
        avec Andrew Granville
        Mathematika  vol. 43 no 1, pages 73--107    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 12] 
        For many years, Paul Erdös has asked intriguing questions concerning the prime divisors of binomial coefficients, and the powers to which they appear. It is evident that, if kk is not too small, then (nk)(nk)  must be highly composite in that it contains many prime factors and often to high powers. It is therefore of interest to enquire as to how infrequently (nk)(nk) is squarefree. One well-known conjecture, due to Erdös, is that (2nn)(2nn) is not squarefree once n≥5n≥5. Sarközy proved this for sufficiently large nn but here we return to and solve the original question.
      3. Sur un théorème de Mertens (2002)
        Manuscripta Mathematica  vol. 108 no 4, pages 495--513    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 13] 
        We investigate and improve on a proof of Mertens concerning the distribution of primes in arithmetic progressions. As a by-product, we establish fairly efficient numerical bounds for related quantities.
      4. Short effective intervals containing primes (2003)
        avec Yannick Saouter
        Journal of Number Theory  vol. 98 no 1, pages 10--33    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 14] 
        We prove that every interval ]x(1−Δ−1),x]]x(1−Δ−1),x]  contains a prime number with Δ=28 314 000Δ=28 314 000  and provided x≥10 726 905 041x≥10 726 905 041. The proof combines analytical, sieve and algorithmical methods.
      5. Explicit estimates for the summatory function of Λ(n)/nΛ(n)/n  from the one of Λ(n)Λ(n) (2013)
        Acta Arithmetica  vol. 159 no 2, pages 113--122    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 15] 
        We prove that the error term ∑n≤xΛ(n)/n−logx+γ∑n≤xΛ(n)/n−log⁡x+γ differs from (ψ(x)−x)/x(ψ(x)−x)/x  by a well controlled function. We deduce very precise numerical results from this formula. Corrigendum here.
      6. Corrigendum to ``Explicit estimates for the summatory function of Λ(n)/nΛ(n)/n from the one of Λ(n)Λ(n)'' (2023)
        Acta Arithmetica  vol. 211 no 1, pages 93--96    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 16] 
      7. Some elementary explicit bounds for two mollifications of the Moebius function (2013)
        Functiones et Approximatio  vol. 49, pages 229--240    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 17] 
        We prove that the sum ∑{d≤x,(d,r)=1μ(d)/d1+ε∑{d≤x,(d,r)=1μ(d)/d1+ε  is bounded by 1+ε1+ε, uniformly in x≥1x≥1, rr  and ε>0ε>0. We prove a similar estimate for the quantity ∑{d≤x,(d,r)=1μ(d)log(x/d)/d1+ε∑{d≤x,(d,r)=1μ(d)log⁡(x/d)/d1+ε. When ε=0ε=0, rr varies between 1 and a hundred, and xx  is below a million, this sum is non-negative and this raises the question as to whether it is non-negative for every~xx.
      8. From explicit estimates for the primes to explicit estimates for the Moebius function (2013)
        Acta Arithmetica  vol 157 no 4, pages 365--379    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 18] 
        We prove two explicit estimates respectively slightly stronger than |∑d≤Dμ(d)|/D≤0.013/logD|∑d≤Dμ(d)|/D≤0.013/log⁡D  for every D≥1100000D≥1100000  and than |∑d≤Dμ(d)/d|≤0.026/logD|∑d≤Dμ(d)/d|≤0.026/log⁡D  for every D≥61000D≥61000.
      9. Explicit estimates on the summatory functions of the Moebius function with coprimality restrictions (2014)
        Acta Arithmetica  vol 165 no 1, pages 1--10    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 19] 
        We prove that |∑{d≤x,(d,q)=1μ(d)/d|≤2.4(q/φ(q))/log(x/q)|∑{d≤x,(d,q)=1μ(d)/d|≤2.4(q/φ(q))/log⁡(x/q)  for every x>q≥1x>q≥1  and similar estimates for the Liouville functions. We give also better constants when x/qx/q  is larger.
      10. Explicit estimates on several summatory functions involving the Moebius function (2015)
        Mathematics of Computation  vol 84 no 293, pages 1359--1387    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 20] 
        We prove that |∑d≤xμ(d)/d|logx≤1/69|∑d≤xμ(d)/d|log⁡x≤1/69  when x≥96955x≥96955  and deduce from that: |∑{d≤x,(d,q)=1μ(d)/d|log(x/q)≤45q/φ(q)|∑{d≤x,(d,q)=1μ(d)/d|log⁡(x/q)≤45q/φ(q)  for every x>q≥1x>q≥1. Furthermore we prove that |1−∑d≤xμ(d)log(x/d)/d|≤314/logx|1−∑d≤xμ(d)log⁡(x/d)/d|≤314/log⁡x  and several similar bounds, from which we also prove corresponding bounds when summing the same quantity, but with the additional condition (d,q)=1(d,q)=1. We prove similar results for ∑d≤xμ(d)log2(x/d)/d∑d≤xμ(d)log2⁡(x/d)/d, among which we mention the bound |∑d≤xμ(d)log2(x/d)/d−2logx+2γ0|≤524/logx|∑d≤xμ(d)log2⁡(x/d)/d−2log⁡x+2γ0|≤524/log⁡x, where γ0γ0  is the Euler constant.         The GP scripts used are to be found on the AMS web site (reference version) and here.
      11. Corrigendum to Explicit estimates on several summatory functions involving the Moebius function (2019)
        Mathematics of Computation  vol 88 no 319, pages 2383--2388    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 21]

      12. A sketch of H. Helfgott's proof of Goldbach's Ternary Conjecture (2015)
        A 5-pages long Appendix in "Goldbach's Conjecture: Selected Topics" by Michael Rassias    » Abstract  » Local pdf+[Article no 22] 
        In 2014, Harald Helfgott published a preprint containing a proof that every odd integer strictly larger than 55  is a sum of three primes. The proof is still to be verified, but it is likely to be correct. The fact that this proof has now some slack goes in this direction. The aim of this appendix is to sketch it and to try to underline the major argument.
      13. Explicit estimates: from Λ(n)Λ(n)  in arithmetic progressions to Λ(n)/nΛ(n)/n (2017)
        avec David Platt
        Experimental Mathematics  vol. 26 no 1, pages 77--92    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 23] 
        We denote by ψ~(x;q,a)ψ~(x;q,a)  the sum of Λ(n)/nΛ(n)/n  for all n≤xn≤x  and congruent to amodqamodq  and similary by ψ(x;q,a)ψ(x;q,a)  the sum of Λ(n)Λ(n)  over the same set. We show that the error term in ψ~(x;q,a)−(logx)/φ(q)−C(q,a)ψ~(x;q,a)−(log⁡x)/φ(q)−C(q,a), for a suitable constant C(q,a)C(q,a)  can be controlled by that of ψ(y;q,a)−y/φ(q)ψ(y;q,a)−y/φ(q) for yy  of size~xx, up to a small error term. As a consequence, if a partial Generalized Riemann Hypothesis has been verified for the LL-functions attached to characters modulo~qq  up to height~HH, this error term is bounded by O(e−H/8)O(e−H/8)  when x≥Hx≥H. Previous methods had at best O(1/H)O(1/H)  instead. We further compute asymptotics for the L22-average of a quantity closely related to~C(q,a)C(q,a).
      14. Products of primes in arithmetic progressions: a footnote in parity breaking (2018)
        avec Aled Walker
        Journal de Théorie des nombres de Bordeaux  vol. 30 no 1, pages 219--225    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 24] 
        We prove that, if xx  and q⩽x1/16q⩽x1/16  are two parameters, then for any invertible residue class aa  modulo qq  there exists a product of exactly three primes, each one below x1/3x1/3, that is congruent to aa  modulo qq.
      15. Products of primes in arithmetic progressions (2020)
        avec Priyamvad Srivastav, with an appendix of Oriol Serra
        International Journal of Number Theory  vol. 16 no 4, pages 747-766    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 25]

      16. Chowla's conjecture: from the Liouville function to the Moebius function (2018)

      17. On the missing Log factor (2018)
        Ergodic Theory and Dynamical Systems in their Interactions with Arithmetics and Combinatorics
        (ed. S. Ferenczi, J. Kułaga-Przymus and M. Lemańczyk)          LNM 2213, pages 293-315            » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 27] 
        This paper is the detailled written account of a talk with the same title given during the conference. Its guiding line is the elementarily proven bound |∑n≤xμ(n)/n|≤1|∑n≤xμ(n)/n|≤1. The trivial bound for the implied summation is logx+O(1)log⁡x+O(1), while the Prime Number Theorem tells us that it is o(1)o(1). Our starting estimate thus lies in-between, a fact that we explore under different lights.
      18. Quantitative Steps in Axer-Landau Equivalence Theorem (2019)

The main theorem applies to general problems of this kind.

      20. Product of three primes in large arithmetic progressions (2023)
        avec Ramachandra Balasubramanian and Priyamvad Srivastav
        International Journal of Number Theory  vol. 19 no 4, pages 843--857    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 30] 
        For any ϵ>0ϵ>0, there exists q0(ϵ)q0(ϵ) such for any q≥q0(ϵ)q≥q0(ϵ) and any invertible residue class aa modulo~qq, there exists a natural number that is congruent to aa modulo~qq and that is the product of exactly three primes, all of which are below q32+ϵq32+ϵ. If we restrict our attention to odd moduli qq that do not have prime factors congruent to~1 mod~4, we can find such primes below q118+ϵq118+ϵ. If we further restrict our set of moduli to prime qq that are such that (q−1,4⋅7⋅11⋅17⋅23⋅29)=2(q−1,4⋅7⋅11⋅17⋅23⋅29)=2, we can find such primes below q65+ϵq65+ϵ. Finally, for any ϵ>0ϵ>0, there exists q0(ϵ)q0(ϵ) such that when q≥q0(ϵ)q≥q0(ϵ), there exists a natural number that is congruent to aa modulo~qq and that is the product of exactly four primes, all of which are below q(logq)6q(log⁡q)6.

      22. From explicit estimates for the primes to explicit estimates for the Moebius function -- II (2025)
        avec Sebastian Zuniga Alterman

        ∣∣∣∑n≤Xμ(n)∣∣∣∣∣∣∑n≤Xμ(n)n∣∣∣≤0.006688XlogX,≤0.010032logX,for X≥1798118,for X≥617990.|∑n≤Xμ(n)|≤0.006688Xlog⁡X,for X≥1798118,|∑n≤Xμ(n)n|≤0.010032log⁡X,for X≥617990.

      23. Moebius function and primes: an identity factory with applications (2023)
        avec Sebastian Zuniga Alterman and Michel Balazard
        Submitted 30 pages    » Abstract  » Local pdf+[Preprint no 3] 
        We study the sums ∑n≤X,(n,q)=1μ(n)log(X/n)kns∑n≤X,(n,q)=1μ(n)log⁡(X/n)kns in an explicit manner where k∈{0,1}k∈{0,1}, s∈Cs∈C and Rs>0ℜs>0. To do so, we introduce a large family of arithmetical identities. In an appendix, we complete this work by a direct proof along similar lines of the inequality ∑n≤XΛ(n)/n≤logX∑n≤XΛ(n)/n≤log⁡X.
        An appendix by Michel Balazard uses a similar setting to prove that ∑n≤xΛ(n)/n≤logx∑n≤xΛ(n)/n≤log⁡x.
      24. A Moebius sum (2023)
        avec Sebastian Zuniga Alterman

        avec Andrew Granville
        Mathematika  vol. 43 no 1, pages 73--107    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[*] 
        For many years, Paul Erdös has asked intriguing questions concerning the prime divisors of binomial coefficients, and the powers to which they appear. It is evident that, if kk  is not too small, then (nk)(nk)  must be highly composite in that it contains many prime factors and often to high powers. It is therefore of interest to enquire as to how infrequently (nk)(nk)  is squarefree. One well-known conjecture, due to Erdös, is that (2nn)(2nn)  is not squarefree once n≥5n≥5. Sarközy proved this for sufficiently large nn but here we return to and solve the original question.

      3. Algebra of Matrix Arithmetic (1998)
        avec Gautami Bhowmik
        Journal of Algebra  vol. 210 no 1, pages 194--215    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 50] 
        We study the algebra of the arithmetic of integer matrices. A link is established between the divisor classes of matrices and lattices.       4. Rationality of the zeta function of the subgroups of abelian pp-groups (2017)

We also provide two explicit examples in rank r=3r=3  and r=4r=4  as well as a closed formula for σa(F)σa(F).

        Let KK be a number field and qq an integral ideal in OKOK.       4. A remark on the geometry of spaces of functions with prime frequencies (2014)

      11. Notes on the domain of exponent pairs (2022)
        avec Julien Cassaigne and Sary Drappeau
        Mathematics Newsletter  vol. 33 no. 2, pages 9pp    » Abstract  » Local pdf+[Article no 68] 
        The theory of exponent pairs as initiated by Phillipps in 1933 proposes pairs of exponents (κ,λ)(κ,λ) so that one has ∑n∼Ne2iπφ(n)≪εFκ+εNλ+ε∑n∼Ne2iπφ(n)≪εFκ+εNλ+ε, for any positive εε, where φφ is a 'monomial-like' smooth function whose first derivative is of size about FF.         17 pages    » Abstract  » Local pdf+[Preprint no 8]

      2. The number of rational numbers determined by large sets of integers (2010)

      3. Explicit upper bounds for the remainder in the divisor problem (2012)

      11. Combinatorial problems
        1. A Stronger Model for Peg Solitaire (2021)
          Mathematics Newsletter  vol. 32 no. 2, pages 34--48    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 79] 
          The main problem addressed here is to decide whether it is or not possible to go from a given position on a peg-solitaire board to another one. No non-trivial sufficient conditions are known, but tests have been devised to show it is not possible. We expose the way these tests work in a unified formalism and provide a new one which is strictly stronger than all previous ones.
        2. Graph tower dichromatic polynomial (2004)
          avec Daniel Tanré
          17 pages    » Abstract  » Local pdf+[Preprint no 9] 
          Starting from a non-oriented graph GG and an integer ss, we define the graph tower G(s)G(s). In the linear graph G=LrG=Lr  case, this results in the classical square on r×sr×s  vertices. The aim of this paper is to describe an effective method to compute this dichromatic polynomial ZG(s)(q,v)ZG(s)(q,v)  and to prove rationality of the series ΣG(q,v)[X]=∑s≥1ZG(s)(q,v)Xs−1ΣG(q,v)[X]=∑s≥1ZG(s)(q,v)Xs−1. The functionals created for this purpose are implemented using MuPAD and may be obtained under GPL licence.
        3. Planik and Square Dance, two planar permutation games: solving a simpler Rubik's cube with group theory (2023)
          Resonance, Journal of Science Education  vol. 28 no. 11, pages 1685--1699    » Abstract  » Local pdf   » Journal full text (pdf)+[Article no 80] 
          The Planik is a two dimensional version of a game close to the Rubik cube. In this paper, we present this game and the group theoretical background required to solve it. We adopt a low profile style for students to be able to follow, and add comments aimed at a more experienced audience. We end this study with notes concerning a second family of games that shares similarities with the Planik.

      2. Mémoire d'habilitation à diriger des recherches
        Les articles publiés présentés dans cette thèse ne sont pas incorporés à ce fichier, (2003), 352 pages. Published papers presented in this thesis have not been incorporated to this file.
      3.          Variations modernes sur la suite des nombres premiers
        Où l'on traite de la densité de la suite des sin(p) lorsque p parcourt l'ensemble des nombres premiers.
        (2006), 104 pages.
        S'il est classique que la suite des (sinn)(sin⁡n)  est dense dans [−1,1][−1,1] lorsque nn  parcourt l'ensemble des entiers relatifs, il est moins connu mais tout aussi vrai que la suite des (sinp)(sin⁡p)  lorsque cette fois pp  est réduit à parcourir seulement l'ensemble des nombres premiers positifs a cette même propriété. Mais pour le démontrer, le chemin à parcourir est plus difficile. Nous accompagnons ici le lecteur le long de ce parcours qui permettra de comprendre plus avant la structure des nombres premiers. Il contient une preuve complète de la propriété annoncée à partir de connaissances du niveau de la première année d'université. Les diverses techniques auxiliaires sont décrites en détail afin que le lecteur puisse faire sienne cette démonstration et continuer seul l'exploration de ce domaine.
      4.          Arithmetical Aspects of the Large Sieve Inequality
        With the collaboration of D.S. Ramana
        Hindustan Book Agency (2009), 210 pages.
        This book is an elaboration of a series of lectures given at the Harish-Chandra Research Institute. The reader will be taken through a journey on the arithmetical sides of the large sieve inequality which, when applied to the Farey dissection, will reveal connections between this inequality, the Selberg sieve and other less used notions such as pseudo-characters and the ΛQΛQ-function, as well as extend these theories.
        One of the leading themes of these notes is the notion of so-called local models that throws a unifying light on the subject. As examples and applications, the authors present, among other things, an extension of the Brun-Tichmarsh Theorem, a new proof of Linnik's Theorem on quadratic residues, and an equally novel one of the Vinogradov's Three Primes Theorem; the authors also consider the problem of small prime gaps, of sums of two squarefree numbers and several other ones, some of them new, like a sharp upper bound for the number of twin primes pp  that are such that p+1p+1  is squarefree. In the end the problem of equality in the large sieve inequality is considered, and several results in this area are also proved.
        A publication of Hindustan Book Agency; distributed within the Americas by the American Mathematical Society.
      5.          Un parcours explicite en théorie analytique
        Une version éditée de la partie non publiée de mon mémoire d'habilitation à diriger des recherches, collection à laquelle j'ai ajouté un exposé sur les fonctions pseudo-périodiques. Pdf
        Éditions universitaires Européennes (2010), 120 pages.
        Depuis vingt ans, mon travail porte essentiellement sur les nombres premiers, avec un accent mis sur la nature effective des résultats. Ma thèse d'habilitation à diriger des recherches contenait les articles que j'avais publiés à cette époque dans ce domaine, plusieurs articles d'exposition, ainsi que deux articles non publiés. La présente monographie reprend les parties non encore publiées de cette thèse, et qui sont commentées pour tenir compte des avancées intermédiaires. J'y ai aussi ajouté un exposé sur les propriétés de presque périodicité de certains termes d'erreur en théorie multiplicative. Ce livre parle en conséquence de l'approche géométrique du crible de Selberg, de la constante de Snirel'man, d'un crible local, de majorations et de minorations de L(1,χ)L(1,χ), de formes bilinéaires sur les nombres premiers et enfin d'oscillations de certains termes d'erreur.
      6.          Excursions in Multiplicative Number Theory
        With the collaboration of Pieter Moree and Alisa Sedunova
        Birkhäuser Advanced Texts Basler Lehrbücher, 355 pages.
        This textbook offers a unique exploration of analytic number theory that is focused on explicit and realistic numerical bounds. By giving precise proofs in simplified settings, the author strategically builds practical tools and insights for exploring the behavior of arithmetical functions. An active learning style is encouraged across nearly three hundred exercises, making this an indispensable resource for both students and instructors.
        Designed to allow readers several different pathways to progress from basic notions to active areas of research, the book begins with a study of arithmetic functions and notions of arithmetical interest. From here, several guided «walks» invite readers to continue, offering explorations along three broad themes: the convolution method, the Levin-Faĭnleĭb theorem, and the Mellin transform. Having followed any one of the walks, readers will arrive at «higher ground», where they will find opportunities for extensions and applications, such as the Selberg formula, Exponential sums with arithmetical coefficients, and the Large Sieve Inequality. Methodology is emphasized throughout, with frequent opportunities to explore numerically using computer algebra packages Pari/GP and Sage.
        Excursions in Multiplicative Number Theory is ideal for graduate students and upper-level undergraduate students who are familiar with the fundamentals of analytic number theory. It will also appeal to researchers in mathematics and engineering interested in experimental techniques in this active area.
        Here are the review from MAA, the review from ZentralBlatt, and the one from MathScinet.

      3. Goldbach et les sommes de nombres premiers
        La Recherche, juin 2013, no 476, pages 68--71. Comme me l'a fait remarquer un lecteur attentif, Gérard Cougny, la soit-disant représentation de Christian Goldbach qui accompagne cet article est en fait une photo retouchée de ... Hermann Grassmann (1809-1877) ! La représentation ci-contre n'est PAS non plus CORRECTE, puisqu'il s'agit d'une peinture de Leonhard Euler. Les historiens Adolf P. Juškevič et Judith Kh. Kopelevič, dans le tome 8 de Vita Mathematica portant sur Goldbach et datant de 1983, disent page XI : "Ce livre contient un répertoire ainsi que quelques dessins. Malheureusement, parmi ceux-ci ne se trouve aucun portrait de Goldbach, car apparemment il n'en existe pas" [traduction personnelle de la traduction en allemand de l'original russe]. Je remercie Andréa Bréard de cette référence qui fait autorité. J'en profite pour vous signaler la base hongroise de biographies et de visages de mathématiciens célèbres. Pour autant que j'ai vérifié, cette base est correcte -- mais pas pour la représentation de Goldbach ! Pendant que je suis ici, encore, je signale le texte sur la conjecture de Goldbach de Bruno Martin, texte qui contient notamment une référence vers une version manuscrite de la lettre originale de Goldbach à Euler en 1742.
      4. Prime numbers: Emergence and victories of bilinear forms decomposition
        European Math. Soc. newsletter, décembre 2013, no 90 pages 18--28.

    12. Cours et notes de cours

      1. -♫- Le cours de Allahabad 2005 : Arithmetical aspects of the large sieve inequality. Ce cours a évolué en un livre.
      2. -‡- Le cours de Chennai 2010 : Local models and pseudo-characters: an introduction and an application. .
      3. -☼- Le cours de Chennai 2011 : Long chains of integers with few prime factors. Les résultats dans le domaine ont depuis évolué, voir par exemple cela.
      4. -☺- Le cours de Nouakchott 2012 : Moyennes de fonctions multiplicatives. Une introduction agrémentée d'exercices. Les moyennes sont obtenues de façon élémentaire via la méthode de convolution. Ce cours est devenu une partie de ce livre.
      5. -♥- Le cours de Monastir 2013 : Séries de Dirichlet et transformées de Mellin en théorie analytique des nombres. Une introduction agrémentée d'exercices. Les moyennes sont obtenues de façon analytique via une formule de Perron tronquée. Ce cours est devenu une partie de ce livre.
      6. -⌂- Le cours de Nouakchott 2013 : Moyennes de fonctions multiplicatives : l'approche analytique. Une introduction agrémentée d'exercices. Les moyennes sont obtenues de façon analytique via une formule de Perron lisse. Ce cours est devenu une partie de ce livre.
      7. -⟡- The Lethbridge Lectures, 2014 : Bilinear decomposition and Gallagher-like Theorem for the Möbius function . Lethbridge University, Canada, February 22nd -- March 6th.
      8. -❖- The Kolkata Lectures, 2022 : On the Transference Principle for Primes. Enveloping Sieve, Majorant Property and some Examples .
